entries.meaning: (Scotland, property law, historical) Land held in feudal tenure.

verbs.description: feu (third-person singular simple present feus, present participle feuing, simple past and past participle feued)

entries.meaning: (Scotland, law, transitive) To bring (land) under the system of feudal tenure.
examples: The Village of OLD KEITH is of ancient date, having been partly feued by the predecessors of the Family of Forbes, and partly feued by the Ministers, and stands upon the glebe: this Village is greatly on the decline, and almost a ruin.—About the year 1750, the late Lord FINDLATER divided a barren Muir, and feued it out in small lots […] .
